description: The genus Argiope includes rather large and spectacular spiders that often have a strikingly coloured abdomen. These spiders are distributed throughout the world. Most countries in tropical or temperate climates host one or more species that are similar in appearance. The etymology of the name is from a Greek name meaning silver-faced.
label: Argiope
name: Argiope

description: Ticks are small arachnids in the order Ixodida. Along with mites they constitute the subclass Acarina. Ticks are ectoparasites living by hematophagy on the blood of mammals birds and sometimes reptiles and amphibians.
label: Tick
name: Tick

description: A pseudoscorpion (also known as a false scorpion or book scorpion) is an arachnid belonging to the order Pseudoscorpionida also known as Pseudoscorpiones or Chelonethida. Pseudoscorpions are generally beneficial to humans since they prey on clothes moth larvae carpet beetle larvae booklice ants mites and small flies. They are small and inoffensive and are rarely seen due to their size.
label: Pseudoscorpion
name: Pseudoscorpions (false scorpions)

description: Amblypygi is an order of invertebrate animals belonging to the class Arachnida in the subphylum Chelicerata of the phylum Arthropoda. They form a separate order of arachnids alongside the spiders scorpions and others. Amblypygids are also known as whip spiders and tailless whip scorpions (not to be confused with whip scorpions that belong to the Arachnid order Thelyphonida). The name amblypygid means blunt rump a reference to a lack of the telson (tail) carried by related species.
label: Amblypygi
name: Amblypygi

description: Schizomida (common name shorttailed whipscorpion) is an order of arachnids superficially resembling spiders and generally less than 5 millimetres in length. The order is not yet widely studied. As of 2005 more than 230 species of schizomids have been described worldwide most belonging to the Hubbardiidae family. A systematic review including a full catalogue may be found in Reddell & Cokendolpher (1995).
label: Schizomida
name: Schizomida

description: Opiliones (formerly Phalangida) are an order of arachnids commonly known as harvestmen. As of December 2011 over 6500 species of harvestmen have been discovered worldwide although the real number of extant species may exceed 10000. The order Opiliones includes four suborders: Cyphophthalmi Eupnoi Dyspnoi and Laniatores.
label: Opiliones
name: Opiliones

description: Neaetha is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders).
label: Neaetha
name: Neaetha

description: Nebridia is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders) with four species. Two occur in South America two on Hispaniola.
label: Nebridia
name: Nebridia

description: Neobrettus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders).
label: Neobrettus
name: Neobrettus

description: Neonella is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). Its species occur from the USA to Argentina.
label: Neonella
name: Neonella

description: Neon is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). Its 25 described species occur mostly in Eurasia with some species found in North and South America. One species N. convolutus is also found in Algeria.
label: Neon
name: Neon

description: Nimbarus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). Its single described species is found in Guinea.
label: Nimbarus
name: Nimbarus

description: Noegus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). Most species occur in South America with few reaching north up to Guatemala.
label: Noegus
name: Noegus

description: Nosferattus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). All described species are found in Brazil.
label: Nosferattus
name: Nosferattus

description: Nycerella is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). The genus was renamed from Cyrene Peckham & Peckham 1893 because the name was preoccupied.
label: Nycerella
name: Nycerella

description: Ocnotelus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders).
label: Ocnotelus
name: Ocnotelus

description: Ocrisiona is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). O. frenata from Hong Kong belongs not to Ocrisiona but to a different unspecified genus according to Zabka (1990). Simon places the genus Ocrisiona close to Holoplatys.
label: Ocrisiona
name: Ocrisiona

description: Ogdenia is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). Its only described species O. mutilla is endemic to Sarawak Borneo. Peckham & Peckham regarded the species as being close to Hasarius. The female epigyne was drawn by Proszynsky (1984). The genus was originally called Rooseveltia but replaced by the original authors a year later.
label: Ogdenia
name: Ogdenia

description: Omoedus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders).
label: Omoedus
name: Omoedus

description: Onomastus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders).
label: Onomastus
name: Onomastus

description: Opisthoncana is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). Its sole described species O. formidabilis has only been found on New Ireland near New Guinea.
label: Opisthoncana
name: Opisthoncana

description: Opisthoncus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). Many Australian species are as yet undescribed.
label: Opisthoncus
name: Opisthoncus

description: Orissania is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). Its single described species is found in India.
label: Orissania
name: Orissania

description: Orsima is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). O. ichneumon has been suggested to be a Polyrhachis ant mimic in reverse however a recent study dismissed this.
label: Orsima
name: Orsima

description: Orvilleus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders). The genus's lone-described species Orvilleus crassus is found only in Panama.
label: Orvilleus
name: Orvilleus

description: Orthrus is a spider genus of the Salticidae family (jumping spiders).
label: Orthrus
name: ''orthrus

description: Apopyllus is a spider genus in the family Gnaphosidae.
label: Apopyllus
name: Apopyllus

description: Galeodes is a genus of solifuges or sun spiders. The nearly 200 species in this genus are found in northern Africa southeastern Europe and Asia. Like other solifuges they are mainly nocturnal and found in arid habitats. The often have long hairy appendages and are not as stout bodied or dark and contrastingly coloured as some other solifuges. Some Galeodes species are able to produce sounds by stridulation.
label: Galeodes
name: Galeodes

description: Liponyssoides sanguineus is a species of mite. It infests Mus musculus. It can transmit human disease. It can transmit Rickettsia akari which causes rickettsialpox. It was previously known as Allodermanyssus sanguineus.
label: Liponyssoides sanguineus
name: Liponyssoides sanguineus

description: Sarcoptidae is a family of mites of which the most prominent are in the Genus Sarcoptes. Sarcoptic mange is caused by digging mites in that genus.
label: Sarcoptidae
name: Sarcoptidae

description: Pyroglyphidae is a family of mites.
label: Pyroglyphidae
name: Pyroglyphidae

description: Psoroptidae is a family of mites.
label: Psoroptidae
name: Psoroptidae

description: Argas is a genus of tick.
label: Argas
name: Argas

description: The Trombidiformes is a large diverse order of mites comprising around 125 families and more than 22000 described species. The group has few synapomorphies by which it can be defined unlike the other major group of acariform mites Sarcoptiformes. Its members include medically important mites and many agriculturally important species including the spider mites and gall mites. Trombidiformes can be divided into Sphaerolichida and Prostigmata.
label: Trombidiformes
name: Trombidiformes

description: Sarcoptiformes is an order of Acari comprising over 15000 described species in around 230 families which are divided into two suborders Oribatida and Astigmata.
label: Sarcoptiformes
name: Sarcoptiformes

description: Haemaphysalis is a genus of tick.
label: Haemaphysalis
name: Haemaphysalis

description: Anystis is a genus of mite. It includes the species Anystis baccarum.
label: Anystis
name: Anystis

description: Eupodes is a genus of mites. It includes the species Eupodes minutus.
label: Eupodes
name: Eupodes

description: Eleutherengonides is a group of mites ranked as a supercohort between the taxonomic rank of order and family.
label: Eleutherengonides
name: Eleutherengonides

description: Parasitengona is a group of mites ranked as a cohort between the taxonomic rank of order and family.
label: Parasitengona
name: Parasitengona

description: Opilioacarus is a genus of mites containing the following species: Opilioacarus bajacalifornicus Opilioacarus italicus Opilioacarus nicaraguensis Opilioacarus nohbecanus Opilioacarus ojastii Opilioacarus orghidani Opilioacarus platensis Opilioacarus segmentatus Opilioacarus siankaanensis Opilioacarus texanus Opilioacarus vanderhammeni
label: Opilioacarus
name: Opilioacarus

label: Eriophyes

label: Bdelloidea
name: Bdelloidea

description: Bdellodes is a genus of mites including the species Bdellodes lapidaria.
label: Bdellodes
name: Bdellodes

description: Hydrachnidiae are a group of mites containing over 5000 species found in freshwater habitat.
label: Hydrachnidiae
name: Hydrachnidiae

description: Holothyrus is a genus of mites in the order Holothyrida. It includes two species Holothyrus coccinella and Holothyrus legendrei.
label: Holothyrus
name: Holothyrus

description: Calyptostoma is a genus of mites.
label: Calyptostoma
name: Calyptostoma

description: Alycus is a genus of mite including the species Alycus roseus.
label: Alycus
name: Alycus

description: Tyrophagus is a genus of mites in the family Acaridae.
label: Tyrophagus
name: Tyrophagus

description: Histiostoma is a genus of mites including the species Histiostoma polypori.
label: Histiostoma
name: Histiostoma

description: Sarcoptoidea is a superfamily of mites including many associated with mammals.
label: Sarcoptoidea
name: Sarcoptoidea

description: Macronyssidae is a family of parasitic mites in the order Mesostigmata.
label: Macronyssidae
name: Macronyssidae

description: Laelapidae is a family of mites in the order Mesostigmata. The family is also referred to in the literature as Laelaptidae and this may be the correct spelling.
label: Laelapidae
name: Laelapidae

description: Hottentotta tamulus the Indian red scorpion (also known as eastern Indian scorpion) is a species of scorpion belonging to the family Buthidae. It occurs in most of India eastern Pakistan and the eastern lowlands of Nepal.
label: Hottentotta tamulus
name: Hottentotta tamulus

description: Ananteris sabineae is a species of scorpion. It has a pale pigmentation of its pedipalps and legs and a dark pigmentation of its carapace. It also has less yellow spots. It is closely related to Ananteris pydanieli.
label: Ananteris sabineae
name: Ananteris sabineae

description: The six-spotted fishing spider Dolomedes triton is an arachnid from the nursery web spider family Pisauridae. This species is from the genus Dolomedes the fishing spiders. This species of fishing spider is named after the mythological Greek god Triton who is the messenger of the big sea and the son of Poseidon.
label: Six-spotted fishing spider
name: Six-spotted fishing spider

description: Zealanapis is a spider genus in the family Anapidae found in New Zealand.
label: Zealanapis
name: Zealanapis

description: Zealanapis australis is a spider species in the genus Zealanapis found in New Zealand.
label: Zealanapis australis
name: Zealanapis australis

description: Ananteris pydanieli is a species of scorpion from Brazilian Amazonia. It is a member of the Buthidae family.
label: Ananteris pydanieli
name: Ananteris pydanieli

description: Heterometrus which members are also known by the collective vernacular name giant forest scorpions is a genus of scorpion belonging to the family Scorpionidae. It is distributed widely across tropical and subtropical southeastern Asia including Cambodia Laos Thailand Vietnam as well as India Sri Lanka Nepal and China. It is notable for containing some of the largest living species of scorpions.
label: Heterometrus
name: Heterometrus

description: Acantholycosa is a genus of wolf spiders. Members of this genus can be distinguished from closely related genera by the presence of more than three pairs of ventral tibial spines on each front leg.
label: Acantholycosa
name: Acantholycosa

description: Scoloderus is a genus of orb-weaving spider of the family Araneidae which feed largely on nocturnal moths. Scoloderus spiders make a ladder type nest with vertical extensions of sticky orbs above and below the circumference of the primary orb. When a moth strikes the web it slides down the ladder leaving behind scales on the sticky silk till it is completely ensnared.
label: Scoloderus
name: Scoloderus

description: Sinolaelaps is a genus of mites in the family Laelapidae.
label: Sinolaelaps
name: Sinolaelaps

description: Sphaeroseius is a genus of mites in the family Laelapidae.
label: Sphaeroseius

label: Stamfordia
